issue.description: DIS copyright notice is missing from cover

comment.description: Updated the cover page to conform to DIS as per Supplementary directives.
Fixed the XSL so that if no abstract is provided, the scope statement is used.

issue.description: If document is DIS, then there should be a supersedes number, and that is missing.

comment.description: A modular AP can go straight to DIS stage which is the case her therefore no Supersedes document.

issue.description:
In the foreword "Subsequent annexes are for information only."
should say :
"Annexes F and G are for information only."
The boilerplate is for a TS, not sure if this applies for a DIS document.

comment.description: Updated the foreword to conform to DIS as per Supplementary directives.

issue.description: Is shading allowed in tables? The SD's use shading to distinguish examples from the text, but since shading is not allowed in figures, I suspect it is not allowed in tables.

comment.description: Assuming the issue is against "Figure 2 Market segmentation", the figure is a figure, not a table. Furthermore, how are you supposed to convey the information without shading?

issue.description: the words "for example" is in one of the scope statements, which means it should be tagged as an example.

comment.description: The scope is pulled from the AP module. The scope has been fixed in the AP module.

issue.description: Introduction In the caption of Figure 1, the word "Vision" should not be capitalized.
Only two modules are referenced in the ARM and MIM short form, yet there are many modules listed in the normative references. Please explain why all these references are needed.

comment.description: There was an agreement at Poitiers that the higher level modules in an AP should be described in clause 4, so they are needed as they are normatively described in clause 4.

issue.description: ISO CS has been questioning the use of dated references. Is it necessary to refer only to the versions listed? Or could undated references be used?

comment.description: this will be a biggish change to the XSL - also, it will affect the modules, a number of which are on their way to ISO.

issue.description:
Use boilerplate specified in ISO Directives, Part 2:
"The following referenced documents are indispensable for the application of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) applies."

comment.description: RBN - I presume you mean replace: " The following normative documents contain provisions which, through reference in this text, constitute provisions of this International Standard. For dated references, subsequent amendments to, or revisions of, any of these publications do not apply. However, parties to agreements based on this International Standard are encouraged to investigate the possibility of applying the most recent editions of the normative documents indicated below. For undated references, the latest edition of the normative document referred to applies. Members of ISO and IEC maintain registers of currently valid International Standards." I have replaced it.

issue.description:
3.18 Abbreviations
ASPI: Why are all words except "set" capitalized?
The acronym FAA stands for "Federal Aviation Administration".

comment.description: RBN - because the acronym is: APSI - Assured set of Product and Support Information "set" is not part of the acronym.

issue.description:
4 Information Requirements
NOTE 1 The information requirements correspond to those of the activities identified as being within the scope of this application protocol in Annex E.
The reference should be to Annex F, not Annex E. (The hyperlink actually goes to Annex F.)
Since there is only one note in the section, this note should not be numbered.
The references to modules that are followed by a punctuation have an unnecessary space between the module number and the punctuation.
